On the samba server, you need to run the following command: "smbpasswd -a your_username" and then enter the password there.  You also need to ensure that the folder you want to mount is shared either using System > Administration > Shared Folders or by editing /etc/samba/smb.conf directly and restarting samba (/etc/init.d/samba restart).

No, you type "smbpasswd -a hoehaver" (assuming that's your username).
That will add user hoehaver to the smbpasswd file.
